definition: to capture/to restrain/to constrain/to adhere rigidly to/inflexible

sentences.english: Illegal detention 'is an everyday occurrence in China,' Mr. Kine said.
sentences.chinese: 凱恩說，在中國每天都有非法拘禁的事發生。

sentences.english: That I would be held under arrest for perjury.
Most of the artifacts at the Heart Mountain Interpretive Learning Center were donated by former internees.
sentences.chinese: 大部分於心山解釋學習中心的文物捐贈前的拘禁。

sentences.english: The four activists fear they will face torture and other ill-treatment in police custody.
sentences.chinese: 四名運動者憂慮他們若被警察拘禁，恐遭受刑求虐待。

sentences.english: Physical abuse is not the only human rights violation children suffer in detention.
sentences.chinese: 兒童被拘禁時所遭受的人權侵犯不僅只是肉體虐待。

sentences.english: The king cinched his party's victory in the election by imprisoning the opposition leaders.
sentences.chinese: 國王拘禁反對黨領袖以確保自己的黨在選舉中獲勝。

sentences.english: He has been released but remains under extra-legal house detention.
sentences.chinese: 他現已被釋放，但仍被非法拘禁。

sentences.english: Suu Kyi has been detained for more than 14 of the past 20 years.
sentences.chinese: 翁山蘇姬在過去20年已被軍政權拘禁超過14年。

sentences.english: After returning to Nanjing, Chiang Kai-shek immediately imprisoned Zhang Xueliang.
sentences.chinese: 蔣介石飛回南京後，立即把張學良拘禁起來。

sentences.english: Assange is currently behind bars in a south London prison.
sentences.chinese: 阿桑奇目前正被拘禁在南倫敦監獄中。

sentences.english: Provided that he shall not be so confined for more than 7 days without his consent.
sentences.chinese: 但未經該被羈留者同意，不得將他如此拘禁超過7天。

definition: in custody/to keep sb in detention
to imprison/to place under house arrest
to detain/to take into custody/to imprison temporarily
to beat a prisoner (to obtain confessions)/to give sb the third degree/to torture
to imprison/to jail/to take into custody
an execution/to put sb to death
